channel.title: Finance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Finance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: China does not need Nvidia chips in the AI war — export controls only pushed it to build its own AI machine
item.description: If the U.S. wants to lead in AI, chip controls are not the answer.

item.title: Exclusive: Former Citadel employees raise $17 million for Fin, a global stablecoin app ‘without all the complexity’
item.description: The startup aims to allow businesses to conduct big cross-border transactions in cheap and rapid fashion.

item.title: ‘Destiny 2: Renegades’ Arrives With A Hilariously Broken Build
item.description: Destiny 2 Renegades is here, and with it comes one of the strongest enemy clearing builds in the entire game, and it's so easy.

item.title: L’Oreal CHRO cut her teeth at luxury brands Chanel and Kiehl’s—like Walmart’s CEO she says the secret to her success was always saying yes
item.description: Like Walmart’s CEO, L’Oreal exec says the the secret to her success was always saying yes—to grabbing coffee, taking notes, moving abroad

item.title: Ferrari Shares Stall; Is Porsche EV Failure Spooking Investors?
item.description: Echoes from the Porsche EV debacle could be spooking Ferrari shareholders, as it prepares its own EV. Ferrari’s shares are wallowing at year lows, awa...

item.title: Private sector unexpectedly lost 32,000 jobs in November, ADP says
item.description: Payroll processing firm ADP on Wednesday released its private sector jobs data for November. Employment in the private sector decreased by 32,000 jobs...

item.title: The Amazon: Both Forest And River Are Critical To Climate Solutions
item.description: The health of the Amazon forest and river are intertwined. By storing carbon, the forest can be a key part of climate solutions but plans for expandin...

item.title: Bungie’s ‘Marathon’ Plagiarism Scandal Comes To A ‘Satisfactory’ End
item.description: The Marathon plagiarism scandal is over after Bungie and the artist in question have come to terms. But there's lasting damage all the same.

item.title: Boeing’s new CFO sees ‘performance culture’ driving a return to positive cash flow next year
item.description: Jay Malave joined the Fortune 500 company in August.

item.title: iOS 26.2 Release Date: Millions Of iPhone Users Must Upgrade From iOS 18, Report Says
item.description: Until now, iPhone users have been able to choose between staying on iOS 18 and jumping to iOS 26. That option is about to vanish.

item.title: Fund managers from diverse backgrounds are delivering standout returns and the smart money is slowly starting to pay attention
item.description: Since 2016, we’ve invested through diverse fund managers, seeing steady, market-rate performance. An entrenched "old-boy" network keeps us in the mino...

item.title: San Francisco sues 10 major food manufacturers over ultra-processed foods
item.description: City attorney files groundbreaking lawsuit against 10 food manufacturers, claiming ultra-processed products fuel public health crisis with rising dise...

item.title: Dollar Tree lifts earnings forecasts as consumers seek out bargains
Economic calendar: Shutdown-delayed report on industrial output among day’s data
U.S. economy has lost jobs in three of past four months: ADP
Macy’s delivers sales and profit surprises to Wall Street
Hugo Boss stock slumps after clothing company's profit warning
Oil and gas prices expected to stay significantly lower through 2026
item.description: Oil and gas prices are set to drop by 2026, with Brent crude falling to $55 per barrel and retail gas reaching $3 per gallon, according to new EIA pro...

item.title: Some Social Security recipients to receive 2 monthly benefit checks in December
item.description: SSI recipients will receive two Social Security payments in December 2025 due to a calendar scheduling quirk that moves January's payment to Dec. 31.

item.title: Musk says AI and robotics are 'only' things that can solve massive US debt crisis
item.description: Elon Musk claims AI and robotics are the only solution to America's $38 trillion debt crisis, predicting dramatic economic changes within three years.

item.title: What to Know About China's DeepSeek AI
item.description: The Chinese upstart says it has trained high-performing AI models cheaply, without using the most advanced chips.

item.title: Silicon Valley Is Raving About a Made-in-China AI Model
item.description: DeepSeek is called “amazing and impressive” despite working with less-advanced chips.

item.title: Reid Hoffman Raises $24.6 Million for AI Cancer-Research Startup
item.description: The LinkedIn co-founder is starting Manas AI with “The Emperor of All Maladies” author Siddhartha Mukherjee.

item.title: Tech, Media & Telecom Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: DeepSeek, SoFi and more in the latest Market Talks covering Technology, Media and Telecom.

item.title: Can an App Replace a Personal Trainer? I Tested Nearly a Dozen to Find Out
item.description: Apps can add flexibility and freshness to your routine. Just try not to get injured.
